dlgLine.text: Don't come any closer! I know how to use this!
You here to rob me? Rape me? Infect me? Talk, dammit!

dlgAnsw.text: I didn't know there was anyone here. I'm not here to hurt you.
I wasn't going to do any of those, but if you're game...
Ask yourself this - if I survived this long, how many people with bigger guns do you think I killed?

dlgLine.text: I don't believe you!
I don't even know what's going on in the world, but I can tell you this - I'm not trusting anyone who just barges into my house.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm from a shelter. We're looking for survivors.
Will you trust me if I can answer your questions?
Please lower your gun. I don't want to have to hurt you.

dlgLine.text: You... animal! Give me one reason I shouldn't put a bullet in your chest!

dlgAnsw.text: I'm not here to hurt you. I'm from a shelter. We're looking for survivors.
Lower your gun. Please.
Because I'm much faster than you. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: I don't care! I will not let myself become a victim. You hear me?!

dlgAnsw.text: Lucky for you, I'm not actually a bad person.
Then lower the gun. Please.
You don't really have a choice. <Attack>

dlgLine.text: Shelter? Aren't those run by the military? You don't look like a soldier to me.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm not. We're a small group of survivors holding out in a school.
You might be waiting a long time for them. If there are any left.
Lady, I'm the Army, Navy, Air force, Marines, and the UFC all rolled into one.

dlgLine.text: I don't know about that. Maybe if you were a cop...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I'm a cop. I'll vouch for 'em.
Well, that doesn't prove anything - anyone can put on a cop's uniform.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Uh, ma'am, Officer Joel Oswalt, Splendid P.D. I am a police officer and I do, um, attest for the truthfulness of the present individual.
Well, that doesn't prove anything - anyone can put on a cop's uniform.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: What happened to all the cops? That infection?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Surely, there's some areas that have restored order by now.

dlgAnsw.text: If anything, it's gotten worse.
A few scattered groups. Like us. Not all of them willing to negotiate.
Lady, have you looked outside lately? It's a fucking nightmare.

dlgLine.text: Small group?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: That has yet to be proven.
Where the hell did you come from?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm from a shelter. I was looking for supplies.
I was looking for survivors. There aren't many of us left.
Lower the gun. Please.

dlgLine.text: I'll lower it when I'm good and ready. Where are you from?

dlgAnsw.text: I'm from a shelter. I was looking for supplies.
I was looking for survivors. There aren't many of us left.
Put down your gun!

dlgLine.text: I don't believe you. I don't even know if I can trust you. Maybe if you were a cop.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -
- New Answ -
- New Answ -

dlgLine.text: You yell at me again and I'll shoot! I swear it!

dlgAnsw.text: Okay, okay. Look I'm from a shelter. You have to believe me.
I really hate diplomacy. It's just so much easier to kill them. <Attack>
I dare you! C'mon, bitch, take the shot!

dlgLine.text: How is that possible? Someone in authority has to be alive - someone has to be coming! I've been waiting for it to be over for weeks now and you tell me no one's left?
No... No, I can't believe that.

dlgAnsw.text: I wish it weren't true.
If they're out there, they're not doing a very good job.
Ignorance is bliss, huh?

dlgLine.text: I haven't left here since the phones went out. You're telling me there's no authority left?

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: This is all because of that disease, isn't it?
You're not carrying it are you?! I don't want to get infected!

dlgAnsw.text: It's not like that. You can't catch it through the air.
The dead are coming back to life - does that sound like a disease to you?!
You ever use a public toilet? Then you already have it.

dlgLine.text: I'm not ignorant - I was prepared. I was being safe! And it sounds like I made the right call, if what you're saying is true.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: What? I never heard anything like that!

dlgAnsw.text: I'm kidding. You only have it if you've been bit. By one of those corpses walking around out there.
This isn't a disease - it's the dead coming back to life!

dlgLine.text: Still... I don't want it - keep your distance.

dlgAnsw.text: You only have it if you've been bit. By one of those corpses walking around out there.
This isn't a disease - it's the dead coming back to life!

dlgLine.text: What are you talking about? I thought that was a rumor. That can't be... I don't believe it. Do you take me for an idiot?

dlgAnsw.text: Why do you think there's nobody left? Most of them are dead and hunting the living.
If you don't believe me, why don't you pop your head out and have a look?

dlgLine.text: Alright... Let's say I believe you. You're looking for survivors? What's in it for me? I don't want to end up in a place that's worse than staying here by myself.
I have supplies, I have a secure property. Assuming you're actually taking care of your group, why would I want to be a part of it?

dlgAnsw.text: How long do you think you can really hold out? Weeks? Months? Then what?
The next people that break in here may shoot first. Maybe even eat you.
I haven't lost our shelter yet. Also, we have free healthcare.
We're the closest thing to society you're going to get.
Who says I'm inviting you to join?

dlgLine.text: I didn't say I wouldn't pull my weight - I've got plenty to offer your group. If what you're saying is true, then it's in my best interests to join a group for protection. At least, until the government cleans this all up.

dlgAnsw.text: If you're willing to share your supplies, you're in.
Fine. You can come with us.
Sorry, you seem like more trouble than you're worth. Forget it.

dlgLine.text: Okay... You've made your point. I'm not 100% comfortable with leaving my house, but if no one's coming, I guess it's the next best thing.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: That's not what I would call a persuasive argument... but I'm tired of waiting around for something to happen. I guess I have to accept that there's no better alternative.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Well, if you're not going to let me into your group, then get out! You're still in my house - I'm not going to sit by while you ransack the place.

dlgAnsw.text: Alright, you can join. I was just messing with you.
Sorry, I need those supplies and I'm not leaving without them. <Attack>
Fine. See ya.

dlgLine.text: That's a real good foot to start on there!

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I'm Sandy Doubleday. But that's not important right now. Let's get these supplies packed, check the generator for fuel, hit up the bathroom for toiletries, and check our gear before we hit the road, shall we?

dlgAnsw.text: Follow me, Sandy.
Works for now. Let's go.

dlgLine.text: We'll work something out.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Hey!
Here's my offer - I've got enough food, gas, and other supplies to last a good long while by myself. You let me be a part of your shelter - on my terms - they're yours.

I'm not some helpless ninny - in fact, I've got more political experience than probably any of you. So... do we have a deal or are you going to do something stupid like risk a gut-shot for a can of carrots?

dlgAnsw.text: Deal. You can join us.
Well, I could take your stuff... but I could always use another lackey too. Okay, you can join up.
Sorry, you were dead the moment I walked in here. <Attack>
Mmm, I love carrots. <Attack>
